meanings.definition: In a way that shows good judgment and practicality.
meanings.sent1: She made the decision sensibly after considering all options.
meanings.sent2: He always handles problems sensibly without overreacting.
meanings.sent3: The cat sensibly chose to nap in the sunniest spot.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches swayed sensibly in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept sensibly, making it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: In a way that is reasonable and logical.
meanings.sent1: They divided the tasks sensibly to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: It is sensibly to wear a helmet while riding a bike.
meanings.sent3: The penguin sensibly wore a tuxedo to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed sensibly around the bend, following the natural path.
meanings.sent5: The detective solved the case sensibly, connecting all the clues.
